title: Charlize Theron says she must 'protect my sources' when asked if Megyn Kelly 'reached out'
text:
Charlize Theron plays Megyn Kelly in Bombshell, a drama examining the women from Fox News who stood up to former network chairman and CEO Roger Ailes.

But she remained coy when asked if Kelly had 'reached out' to her about the movie.

'No,' replied Charlize, when asked by Ellen DeGeneres in an interview to be screened on the upcoming Tuesday edition of her show.

Not giving anything away: Charlize Theron says she must 'protect sources' when asked if Megyn Kelly 'reached out' about new Roger Ailes film Bombshell during an interview on the Ellen DeGeneres Show on Tuesday

Transformed: Charlize is seen in character, left, compared to the real Megyn, right

Charlize then clarified: 'So we used a lot of source material in telling this story. And also spoke to a lot of women who were part of this story.

'Some of them were still working at Fox, some of them really didn't want their names out there. So as a team we've just decided to protect our sources.'

She said of her character: 'Meghan is aware of the film and I'm really hoping she will see it.'

In her shoes: Charlize, seen as Megyn, wouldn't confirm or deny if she had spoken to the former Fox News host directly, but did say she had spoken to many women

Lauded: Charlize, 44, is already garnering awards buzz for her performance in the Jay Roach-directed movie

Charlize, 44, is already garnering awards buzz for her performance in the Jay Roach-directed movie.

She was involved in the movie from the start, through her production company Denver & Delilah.

'It was a script that was sent to my company to possibly produce and maybe for me to work on as an actor,' she explained. 'Everybody knew that this was an incredible gift.'

Dream team: Along with Charlize, the film features Nicole as Gretchen Carlson, who sparked the investigation into Ailes, and Margot Robbie, who plays a fictional character, Kayla

Interview: Ellen DeGeneres spoke to the actresses

Star power: Said Charlize, gesturing to her co-stars who sat alongside her: 'This is like literally a dream come true for me, right here'

Joining Charlize in the movie are Nicole Kidman, who plays Gretchen Carlson, and Margot Robbie, in the role of a fictional woman, Kayla.

Said Charlize, gesturing to her co-stars who sat alongside her: 'This is like literally a dream come true for me, right here.

'The whole cast, are, it's just an amazing group of people. We've been talking [about] how rare it is where you get to work with so many women. Where you get to have an experience where you get to work with people who you admire and not just see them on the red carpet but have a working experience with them.
description: Charlize clarified: 'We  spoke to a lot of women... as a team we've just decided to protect our sources.'
